definition: wheel/disk/ring/steamship/to take turns/to rotate/by turn/classifier for big round objects: disk, or recurring events: round, turn

sentences.english: Donation of 550 wheelchairs at Qinyang, Henan on May 22, 2008.
sentences.chinese: 天鄰基金會捐贈550張輪椅河南省沁陽市殘疾人士。

sentences.english: He is now quadriplegic and confined to a wheelchair.
sentences.chinese: 現在的他四肢麻痹，只能呆在輪椅上。

sentences.english: When I was young, we had a cousin in a wheelchair.
sentences.chinese: 我年輕的時候，我們有一個坐輪椅的表妹在。

sentences.english: In archery people in wheelchairs can compete on equal terms with the able-bodied.
sentences.chinese: 在箭術比賽中，坐輪椅的人可以跟健全的人平等競爭。

sentences.english: The utility model can make person in the wheelchair conveniently get on or get off the car.
sentences.chinese: 可以讓乘坐輪椅車的人羣很方便的上下汽車。

sentences.english: We also offer wheelchair and walking stick. Please contact the Luggage Room if you need.
sentences.chinese: 飯店備有輪椅車和柺杖，如需使用請與行李房聯繫。

sentences.english: Without her wheelchair, Clara attempts to walk and is gradually successful.
sentences.chinese: 沒有了輪椅克拉拉試着練習走路，慢慢得成功了。

sentences.english: An elderly patient was sitting in her wheelchair alone.
sentences.chinese: 一位上了年紀的病人孤獨單地坐在輪椅上。

sentences.english: There sat her elderly friend, parked in a wheel chair, puttering with a row of posies.
sentences.chinese: 她的老朋友坐在輪椅上，正擺弄着一排花束。

sentences.english: I ended up standing in waist-deep water beside the wheelchair, which was stuck in the mud.
sentences.chinese: 結果我站在齊腰深的水裏，身旁輪椅深陷在泥濘中。

sentences.english: Not only that, she is unable to walk and in a wheelchair.
sentences.chinese: 不僅如此，她還無法行走，只能坐輪椅。

sentences.english: She is very lively and beautiful; on all the way, she joked and chated freely with the wheelchair navigator.
sentences.chinese: 她很活潑且美麗，一路與推輪椅的人說說笑笑。

sentences.english: Mostly, he sits in a wheelchair, crippled by brittle bone disease.
sentences.chinese: 由於脆骨病致殘，他大多數情況下坐在輪椅上。

sentences.english: In this chair, I can move by myself;
sentences.chinese: 坐在輪椅裏，我可以行動自如。

definition: unable to move freely/difficult to get about
to lend an arm to support sb
to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
to visit (a patient, prisoner etc)/to look inquiringly
